etymology.description: 入 + 一; alternatively an upside-down 口 + archaic 今.
etymology.interpretation: Combining 'enter' with 'one' sketches things converging toward a single point, evoking the idea of gathering. Another analysis sees a mouth shape with an early form of 今, suggesting a call or order that brings people together.

examples.chinese: 我们在广场集合(我們在廣場集合)。
收到通知后，大家很快聚集起来(收到通知後，大家很快聚集起來)。
examples.pinyin: Shōudào tōngzhī hòu, dàjiā hěn kuài jùjí qǐlái.
examples.english: After receiving the notice, everyone quickly gathered.

examples.chinese: 会议开始前，请先集中注意力(會議開始前，請先集中注意力)。
examples.pinyin: Huìyì kāishǐ qián, qǐng xiān jízhōng zhùyìlì.
examples.english: Before the meeting begins, please focus your attention.
